div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h3.div: FOR STUDENTS WHO MISSED FIRST PICK-UP

div.p: If you are in need of a packet to fulfill your education requirements for the rest of the semester, packets will be passed out on Wednesday, April 15th, from 9:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m. In order to receive a packet, you must do one of the following: call 580-857-2417 ext 501 and leave a message or email cgrimm@allenmustangs.org. You will only need to leave one message. Please state your student's name and grade. Requests must be made in advance.

p.a: Elementary Printable and Virtual Distance Learning Resources

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: The Clever Portal is used by students to access many of the learning apps and sites used in their classes. Students log in with their school Google account: firstnamelastname@allenmustangs.org

p.em: (If students have forgotten their assigned password, they can request it from their teacher.)

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h2.div: 3 yr and New 4 yr olds ONLY

div.p: ***This will not be first come first served, instead students will be placed in the order of resident, birthday, and nonresident (if space is still available).

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: PARENT SURVEY: This survey is to collect information on students' home Internet access to enable Allen Public Schools staff to plan for remote learning opportunities due to long-term school closure (as needed) due to COVID-19.

Our school is planning for the possibility of implementing continuous learning for all students following guidelines that could be developed by the Oklahoma State Department of Education, pending decisions by the State School Board in their meeting this Wednesday. We are looking into all our options that best fit our community.
Please complete one survey per family. THANK YOU!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: I would like to update you on our state closing school. The state school board held a meeting and voted to close schools until April 6th. This includes all instruction and activities. There will be no practicing, games, activities or gatherings at school during this time. The CDC is encouraging everyone to stay home. Administration, cafeteria and maintenance will be the only personnel at school during this time. Our cafeteria will still be serving breakfast and lunch to provide meals to students. We will determine this week how this will look and how we will get the meals to families requesting them.

I realize there is a lot of emotion on what is the right thing to do at this time. Our priority right now is to make sure everyone is safe. I will let you know as soon as I can what this will look like for our school and our students moving forward.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h2.div: JUNIOR HIGH AND HIGH SCHOOL SPIRIT WEEK

h3.div: Virtual Spirit Week fo the Junior High and High School students is this week, April 6-10. We encourage all of you to participate! See the attached flyer for details for each day!

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue; focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

h3.div: Have a great week and stay safe!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

h3.div: Due to current events, Signing Day at Pontotoc Technology Center (Originally scheduled for March 26, 2020) has been postponed. We do not not have a new day scheduled yet, but we will let you know as soon as we know.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Pontotoc Technology Center will join schools across our district and the state of Oklahoma and close effective immediately through Monday, April 6th. For the most up-to-date information, visit their website at www.pontotoctech.edu/covid19

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

li.a: Notification of Opt In or Out of SMS Text Messages
P3-5th Grade Before and After School Care Policy (updated July 9, 2019)

ul.li: OIG Hotline (Report through the link or by calling 1-800-MIS-USED (1-800-647-8733)

p.em: The OIG Hotline is available for anyone who knows of or suspects fraud, waste, abuse, mismanagement, or violations of laws and regulations involving ED funds or programs. This includes allegations of suspected wrongdoing by ED employees, contractors, grantees, schools and school officials, persons in positions of trust involving ED funds or programs, collection agencies, recipients of student financial assistance, or lending institutions.
